title: Tonal Tinnitus Masker
description: Acoustic neuromodulation tool using amplitude and frequency modulation
findFrequencyFirstText: To use this tool effectively, first find your tinnitus frequency using the Frequency Finder tool. Your saved frequency will be used automatically.
modulationTypeTooltip: AM (Amplitude Modulation) varies volume, FM (Frequency Modulation) varies pitch. Both combines both effects. CR uses randomized tone sequences.
modulationRateTooltip: How fast the modulation changes. Lower = slower, smoother changes. Higher = faster, more noticeable changes.
modulationDepthTooltip: How strong the modulation effect is. Lower = subtle, Higher = more pronounced.
baseFrequencyTooltip: The main frequency of the tone. Should match your tinnitus frequency for best results.
randomizedModulationDesc: Automatically vary modulation rate and depth within specified ranges
aboutNeuromodulationText: Acoustic neuromodulation uses modulated tones to potentially reduce tinnitus perception. AM/FM modulation and Coordinated Reset (CR) are research-backed approaches. Use at comfortable volume levels and consult healthcare providers for tinnitus management.
frequencySpreadTooltip: How far above and below your tinnitus frequency the four tones are spaced. Higher values create more variation.
backgroundSoundTooltip: Optional nature sounds to enhance relaxation and mask environmental noise.
waveformTooltip: The waveform shape of the carrier tone. Sine is typically recommended for tinnitus therapy.
earSelectionTooltip: Select which ear or ears should receive the tone. Useful when tinnitus is stronger on one side.
modulationTypeAmDescription: AM (Amplitude): Varies volume to create a pulsing effect.
modulationTypeFmDescription: FM (Frequency): Varies pitch to create a warbling effect.
modulationTypeBothDescription: Both: Combines AM and FM modulation.
modulationTypeCrDescription: CR (Coordinated Reset): Randomized sequence of four tones to desynchronize neural activity.
usageTipStartLowerRates: For AM/FM: Start with lower modulation rates (0.5-2 Hz).
usageTipCrDefaults: For CR: Use default settings (200 ms tone, 50 ms gap, 10% spread).
usageTipPatience: Results may take several weeks to appear.
noteText: This tool is for research and educational purposes. Consult a healthcare professional before using it as tinnitus treatment.
